clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Mucolytic Solution Before Upper Endoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Mucolytic Solution Before Upper Endoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: The study was designed to evaluate the effectiveness of the maximum dose of mucolytic solution used before upper endoscopy on the visibility of the gastric mucosa

detailed_description.textblock: Residual gastric content containing mucus, bubbles, bile and food particles may limit visibility of gastric mucosa and therefore diagnostic yield of upper endoscopy, especially in cases of early neoplastic lesions. Data on benefit of peroral mucolytic solution administered before upper endoscopy are limited.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Visibility score" evaluated by blinded performing endoscopist
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: Visibility score" (0-25 points) counted as the sum of visibility score in the esophagus (0-5), fundus (0-5), corpus (0-5) and atrum (0-5) of the stomach and in the duodenum (0-5).

secondary_outcome.measure: Visibility score" evaluated by two blinded endoscopists using 10 endoscopic images captured during endoscopy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
secondary_outcome.description: "Visibility score" (0-25 points) counted as the sum of visibility score in the esophagus (0-5), fundus (0-5), corpus (0-5) and atrum (0-5) of the stomach and in the duodenum (0-5).

other_outcome.measure: Residual fluid in the stomach evaluated by blinded performing endoscopist

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 18 years, signed informed consent, diagnostic gastroscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 18 years, interventional gastroscopy, known disease of the upper GI tract and/or history of surgery of GI tract, gastroscopy indicated of bleeding, dysphagia or ileus, liver cirrhosis, general anesthesia, allergy to mucolytic solution components, pregnancy
